intro: Terminalia franchetii var. genuina, commonly known as the African wild cherry, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, three-lobed fruits containing flat, winged seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland and montane forests. The species is valued for its timber and has traditional medicinal uses in some regions.
